website_summaries.verdict: Good for sectioning off parts of your trunk and keeping large objects like coolers, balls, and large water jugs from rolling.
pros: Interior is cotton mesh, which stretches well
Sides are bungee, which keeps it in place
Good for sectioning off trunk and creating a barrier

customer_reviews.title: Actual net is only ~36 inches, and does NOT stretch.
customer_reviews.text: Description claims: "45 inch x 24 inch cargo net stretches to 60 inches". However, the net itself is only ~36 inches on the longest dimension, and is made of nylon rope so it does not stretch at all. The joke on you is that there is a bungee cord woven around the perimeter of the net -- and that *cord* stretches to attach to something 60 inches wide. But barely half of the width will be covered by the netting material.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: Used as a doggie barrier
customer_reviews.text: Alrighty, so I wasn't about to shell out $40+ for one of these metal/plastic doggie barriers. After a lot of research, I decided upon this $10 cargo net. I was not disappointed. First of all, it's cheap, but it's not cheap. Seems to be well put together. The anchors it comes with are more than sufficient to hold the net up. I just had to drill two anchors up high and then the bottom pieces connected nicely to seat back. Now I have a great dog barrier to keep the dog from chewing on things he isn't supposed to. Bottom line, for whatever you want to use this for - the price cant be beat. *2009 Ford Escape.
customer_reviews.author: Chad S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect it to hold much
customer_reviews.text: The product images depict using this net as a bag, for example to store groceries in the back of your car. In fact the net is too flimsy to do this; there's no way you could reliably use it as a bag in this way. If the woman holding the bag in that image were to let go, the net would flop down onto the floor and offer no storage space whatsoever. The net probably works fine if all you want to do is section off your car, but for the misleading product images I removed multiple stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Almost a perfect fit for my Honda Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: I will update later if need be, but I wanted to post this picture incase anyone else is looking for their Odyssey. The net fits perfectly on top, but is a bit loose on the bottom. Update: We used this on a trip and it was essential! Without it, everything would have fallen out of the the van every time we opened the door. The rope is a bit thin and snags easily, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: rm

customer_reviews.title: great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: fits well across the tail gate of a 2014 Ford Flex. grabs onto the Ford anchor points securely - no extra work or adapters needed. no drilling, no adhesive. gathered up significant excess net along the bottom using zip ties, to prevent it getting into the liftgate latch. tied to the hidden D-rings near the latch too. if you leave the net floppy it will allow items to escape around the ends. can still raise the 3rd row seats.
customer_reviews.author: cb750

customer_reviews.title: Handy Indispensable piece of equipment for your car
customer_reviews.text: I love this cargo net. It fits my 2015 GMC Terrain perfectly and saves a ton of cargo space. The net stretches sufficiently to fit your cargo area. However please note that it does not come with hooks. The only mounting equipment included in the package are four stick on buttons ( which I doubt will last very long ) and sheet metal screws ( I would never go about drilling holes in my car!). The only real good way to mount it is via hooks or carbiners. Both of which are easily available at my local dollar store Plus you can't beat the price for this net !
customer_reviews.author: Farhan K

customer_reviews.title: Used in tundra bed
customer_reviews.text: I use a 2x6 in the bed of my truck to divide the small section next to the tailgate. Attached the knobs to the wood and zip tied little hooks to the tailgate end of the net. The hooks attach to the trucks existing anchor points. (Hooks not included. I used some pegboard hooks that I wasn't using, but really you could make some with a wire hanger)When we go shopping we throw everything in the back and fasten it down with this net. Works great. Only thing was the screw to fasten the knobs are starting to rust a little.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great net for holding stuff down on the boat
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these to use in the cabin of my sailboat. Under sail the boat can heal 15 to 20 degrees port to starboard. Used the supplied block pucks to attach thes to the boat. Two I use as screens to hold food and gear on shelves and the third I use as a hammock on one wall to store things off the deck. For the price you can not beat the usefullness of these nets.
customer_reviews.author: The Garbone

customer_reviews.title: So far I've been using it regularly for several months and it's held up fine. I've even used it a couple times as ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits into my Jetta Sportwagen perfectly and is significantly less expensive than the OEM version. As a side note, you'll need to buy a set of inexpensive carabiners separately to hook the cargo net to the factory points in the trunk, as it doesn't come with any, but given the overall cost savings, it's a very minor oversight. So far I've been using it regularly for several months and it's held up fine. I've even used it a couple times as a pet barrier over the rear seat in lieu of an expensive metal one (only useful if your pet isn't prone to try and squeeze past it since its soft and flexible).
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Youn

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: our 2nd try at ordering a cargo net went way better; proper measurement before ordering (vs. a guesstimate in the Head) is key ;-) Funny how our kids will be casual about such things when it's not on their dime, no? This is a big help for corralling things in the back of the minivan, so that when the rear hatch is opened, the bag with the eggs or other breakables doesn't shift in transit and have a crash landing.
customer_reviews.author: domestic diva

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my 2010 Toyota Sequoia
customer_reviews.text: I own a 2010 Toyota Sequoia. I was looking for something to keep my loose groceries from falling out when I opened the gate and didn't want to spend a lot of money. This worked perfectly. It comes with 4 plastic knobs that you can attach. Not sure if the sticker on the back of the knobs is enough strength as they have instructions how to drill them into the soft plastic interior panels of your vehicle. My vehicle had some places I could tie the corners to. The netting does have elastic give to stretch out. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Family Man

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cover for SUV trunk area
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2010 Santa Fe and the back (trunk area is open) I wanted something to hide the contents and the shade you can buy is almost $200 and I am cheap.. I bought this cargo net, stretched it horizontal at the top of back seats to the top pegs next to hatchback, lay'd a sun shade on top and now I have a cover no one can see what I have in the (trunk)..
customer_reviews.author: SLC

customer_reviews.title: Mounts use a poor quality adhesive.
customer_reviews.text: The net works fine. I baught this one because Bell is usually a decent brand. What I saved on buying through amazon I am going to have to go spend on adhesive. The point of a cargo net is to keep things from sliding around. If you put barely any pressure at all on the net the mounts fall right off. So it literally can not do the job it's intended for out of the box. The only reason I am giving 2 stars is for the quality of the net, which seems like it should last. If it doesn't I will change this later.
customer_reviews.author: graphicMOG

customer_reviews.title: Everyone with a small camper is always looking for a little more storage space and the nice cupboard held a few items
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a small truck camper bunkbed/cupboard that is over the dinette. Everyone with a small camper is always looking for a little more storage space and the nice cupboard held a few items. Now, with the netting wrapped and tie wrap secured to dowling and using the enclosed hooks that can be screwed down to the wood attached it to the shelf, the storage space increased dramatically and all items are safe behind the net. Note, I have no idea if this DIY project would hold a child in. But it works for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S

customer_reviews.title: Yard inflatables tie downs
customer_reviews.text: Bought ten for yard inflatables see pic works great, but one snap-broke (bungee cord), sent back Amazon replaced, but replacement broke. So check item out- stretch it out. Amazon good for replacing item.
customer_reviews.author: norm

customer_reviews.title: particularly because the back door open automatically so no one needs to be standing back there ready to "catch" anything and al
customer_reviews.text: I installed this net on the back of my SUV to avoid items from falling out when I opened the back door, particularly because the back door open automatically so no one needs to be standing back there ready to "catch" anything and also because when I use the extra 2 seats I have little "trunk" space left so things like grocery bags get placed very close to the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Isaac Gobern

customer_reviews.title: it works awesome, I can go on dirt roads
customer_reviews.text: I put this net in the back of my Toyota Tacoma to hold My cooler from sliding around in the back,it works awesome, I can go on dirt roads,turn corners, my cooler stays put! This is very easy to install,you just need a drill and a screwdriver,takes 10 min.
customer_reviews.author: kevin laird

customer_reviews.title: If I have a lot of groceries I put heavy things that want to slide like jugs of milk and plastic bottles inside the net
customer_reviews.text: This cargo net really did the trick. It comes with four mounting hooks that you can install in any car, but I just used the two hooks that are already built in to my Honda Accord. This way the net is actually folded in half, so you can place items inside fold that you want to hold in place. If I have a lot of groceries I put heavy things that want to slide like jugs of milk and plastic bottles inside the net. Then I place lighter items behind the net so they are held in place as well. Works great -- no more things sliding around in my trunk!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Other uses
customer_reviews.text: Although this net is a Automotive cargo net, I used it to over railing on a bridge that connects two play fort areas. I didn't want my little grandchildren to slip between the slots. I like that the weave is small and thick. I was able to stretch it and staple it and now their play area is safe. I think it would be a great cargo net there are other uses for it.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin

customer_reviews.title: Nets a net
customer_reviews.text: The net itself is nice however I didn't plan on drilling anything in my new jeep. I does also come with the adhesive clips however I'm not sure how well they will hold up. I did find that the carbines from the dollar store worked better to hold stuff in place. The net is not stretchy type but will work for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Lyuba

customer_reviews.title: Only good for laying flat, not for hammock style...
customer_reviews.text: Everything is fine, but I took a star off because: 1. The adhesive is pretty weak. Popped right off, you HAVE to screw it in, which I think is intentional, so that's not the full reason... 2. I wanted to fold it over and have it hang vertically, to make kind of a hammock for my stuff up against the back of the rear seats, but the knobs don't accommodate two loops. Sadness ensued.
customer_reviews.author: T. P.

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2014 Honda Odyssey around built-in hooks
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to leave this here for anybody searching. It fits the built-in cargo hooks in the back of my 2014 Honda Odyssey just fine. Can't compare to the OEM Honda net, but I can't imagine that one is worth fort-five bucks more than this. Just for the record the corners of the net are just loops that fit over the hooks. It does come with adhesive mounts, but those are not needed in the Odyssey.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Its Okay, not awesome.
customer_reviews.text: If you want an extremely stretchy, and large net, get this. It stretches far too much allowing whatever you are trying to contain to fall out constantly. If you are using it as a barrier, plan on everything still coming forward if you get in an accident. If you are looking for something to secure your cargo, choose something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: It made excellent use of the space and had no effect on ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and laced them together with parachute cord. I also used the parachute cord to give the netting extra stability. I hung them on the ceiling of my 2011 Honda Element. It made excellent use of the space and had no effect on my vision through the rear view mirror. The quality was great and easy to install once I had a plan.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy McKay

customer_reviews.title: does its job just not what I imagined
customer_reviews.text: I bought this net to keep my dogs in the back on our trip and also for a grocery holder. I have 2 huskies and it kept them from getting out but it's easily pushed to the side so they kept sticking their heads through. My issue was the actual net portion doesn't stretch. Just the outer edges. So it does stretch to the size stated but leaves huge gaps. I was hoping to stretch it to completely to close the back but it did its job... Barely. Can't go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.author: RoniPoupard

customer_reviews.title: As described except adhesive is weak
customer_reviews.text: Adhesive material on mounts is weak. Will not stay on a clean smooth surface. Will have to drill and screw to attach.
customer_reviews.author: R. Buce

customer_reviews.title: Not just for cars.
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to act as guard rail of sorts for the top bunk in our RV for our 2 year old daughter, we used coat hooks from Target to anchor the webbing to the bed area, she never felt insecure and we didn't have an issue with her or her things falling off the top bunk, it was a great solution for us.
customer_reviews.author: fncycwgrl

customer_reviews.title: Game changer. Used in my 2015 Tahoe and haven't ...
customer_reviews.text: Game changer. Used in my 2015 Tahoe and haven't had any more items randomly falling out of the trunk or playing the spiderman game as the hatch lifts. Def worth the buy..actually, now that i'm writing this, I needed to buy one for the wife too. I see what you are up to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: James Slack

customer_reviews.title: Good product, I don't like that the mesh net ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, I don't like that the mesh net actually slides on the cordage, but I suppose that was the intended purpose of it. It does what it is suppose to and holds down a lot of goods. installed it on both a 2014 Suburban and a 2004 Jeep grand cherokee. Don't bother with the sticky tape tho, just mark and drill (provides the best security).
customer_reviews.author: JayBoi

customer_reviews.title: Good webbing and construction
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2006 Corvette convertible trunk. About $10 vs $60 for a Corvette advertised one. Stretches out to fit the holders the car already has in the trunk. Just fold it in half and put two loops over the fasteners on each side. Just the right height. Good webbing and construction. Works for me.
customer_reviews.author: MJV

customer_reviews.title: Working out great for my application
customer_reviews.text: Using this a child deterrent for some outdoor steps. Couldn't find any retractable gates that would reach the span that I have so this works out perfectly. Using it with some bungee cords allows for quick removal and installation. Prevents children from going down from the deck to the remainder of the yard. No worries about Rustin and rotting. Working out great for my application. Wouldn't recommend for more than 2 steps like my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Dave E.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Nissan Xterra
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2001 Nissan Xterra. I love this net. I didn't bother putting on the adhesive clip things that it comes with because I didn't want to make any permanent additions to my car. It works great, though, for holding groceries and such via the 4 hooks in the floor of the cargo area. It does feel a little loose, sometimes, though, so I sometimes hook right into the net instead of the elastic around the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Serrette

customer_reviews.title: Useful for Holding Items.
customer_reviews.text: Great little cargo net. I actually use it across the back of my truck to hold items when I'm working on a vehicle at home or when I require quick access to various tools when doing projects elsewhere. Good buy. I keep it on 24/7 inside the gate.
customer_reviews.author: TallPollock

customer_reviews.title: Great for non-car uses as well!
customer_reviews.text: We do not use this for the car; rather we use it behind open "cubbies" to prevent the storage bins from pushing into the wall and marking it up. Command Strip hooks worked great to attach this net to the back of a 'cubby'. This net is a great size for a 4 x 2 cubby furniture item like this one: [...].
customer_reviews.author: The Duck

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Them Contained
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my dogs from trying to come in the front seat,...well most of the time. It is kind of comical watching my little one pawing at it and giving me the guilty look. But it keeps the little furry beasts in the back making it safer for all of us.
customer_reviews.author: Windermerewmn

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the adhesive attachment parts that come with this net and I did not want to dril holes into the plastic of my leased Nissan. I purchased my own clips separately. Overall the net is good and inexpensive enough that I didn't mind buying separate clips.
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This cargo net can fit in an SUV as well as a sports car...I ordered a second one after receiving the first and checking it out. Great price and well made! Attach them with spring snap clips (one package will do two nets) found on Amazon. This prevents any items purchased and placed in trunks to not move around from side to side, etc.,thus, preventing damage.
customer_reviews.author: carolineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Need photos from package on the web site.
customer_reviews.text: The net is not the same as it looks much bigger then it really is. The photos on the web site make it look very big I know it tells you the size of it but it also states that it will stretch to much bigger. And the mounting hard wear is not very good. The net has four corners and they have metal taps criped on them to make the loops at each corner and two of them have already broke off and I was just opening the net to see how big it was. Had I know it was so small I would have paid the extra money to get a better one and bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Striepeke

customer_reviews.title: Great net.
customer_reviews.text: Great net. It is stretchable. I used different hooks. The bottom was perfect to hook to my built in anchors in my bed. So I use it to place items between the tailgate and the net. Great for groceries. The mounts on the corners do not do any good. You will want to figure out your own hooks and mount use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: A little big for my Acadia
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2012 GMC Acadia. The quality is very good, but it is a bit big for the back of my car. I had to tie a knot in the top and bottom of the net to shorten it a bit. I didn't use the attachments that they provide. I used some spare spring hooks I have from something else. My GMC already has some U shaped hooks built in.
customer_reviews.author: Dex L

customer_reviews.title: seems to fit just fine in the trunk of my 2002 Honda Accord
customer_reviews.text: seems to fit just fine in the trunk of my 2002 Honda Accord. Divides the trunk perfectly in half, front and back. Keeps stuff from sliding around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A net of Multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this net to customize it into a marine dock box. This really beats purchasing a standard OEM net for 4 or 5 times the price. You can make this work in most applications. Just make sure the measurements are correct and you'll find this is the same quality. Obviously you an use this for any other things as well.... like a dock box.
customer_reviews.author: AlmostEverything84Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hanging speakers from ceiling! Looks great and speakers sound excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Regal1Ohio

customer_reviews.title: A very good high quality net to catch all your stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good substitute for the factory supplied net on my Lincoln that somehow mysteriously disappeared. It catches on the hooks already in the trunk, and keeps items from flying around.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kolar

customer_reviews.title: I use it in my van - does the job ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my van - does the job. I made some modifications to secure the net to the existing van tie-down posts by using small bungee cords from the 99 cent store. I wasn't impressed with the stick-em tie down posts provided by Bell. I paid way less than I would have if I went to the dealer.
customer_reviews.author: JDay

customer_reviews.title: I'm using this net as a door gate on an ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this net as a door gate on an extra wide door. It's well made with 2 ways to attach to surfaces. The adhesive application didn't hold even with light pressure on the net. I used the enclosed screws instead and it's doing the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Katail

customer_reviews.title: works great on play forts too
customer_reviews.text: Actually used it for a protective netting on our play fort and has stood up to rough and tough boys. Cost 1/3 what a "specialty" net would cost and with a few zip ties did the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: what I really like is the mounts
customer_reviews.text: The net is okay...what I really like is the mounts :) they kick A$$. Love them to use with paracord etc..and for the price it's worth just ordering the net for them...of course you can use the net too :)
customer_reviews.author: Broseph

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Many Uses
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to offer added safety to the second level of my daughter's cedar playset. It spans the large opening at the top of the stairs/rock wall and is stretchy enough to lift easily as the kids climb up while preventing easy tips backward during play. Great item, and multipurpose!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee A. Roseland

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is flexible on how to use it
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my new A6 and it fits perfect. I through some clips on the 4 corners, and bring up the middle onto the T-bars in the A6 trunk, making a pocket for groceries, etc. An inexpensive but very functional solution.
customer_reviews.author: T. Matz

customer_reviews.title: Good net
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality cargo net especially for the price. I had hoped that the adhesive had worked better though. I bought it to put at top of my hard side pop-up camper and it was too taut and adhesive came loose. I didn't want to screw in (sounds like a bad idea) so all in all its good but maybe just for a car
customer_reviews.author: cristina sola

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good design that mostly avoids tangles that are common ...
customer_reviews.text: A pretty good design that mostly avoids tangles that are common with some nets. I would like the elastic to be stiffer though.
customer_reviews.author: Cervelo Rider

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed after a car accident removed the tailgate to our truck. Keeps everything in the truck bed and very easy to install. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Hemmerling

customer_reviews.title: works for '13 Hyundai Santa Fe Sport
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2013 santa fe sport. It works fine, no need to use the adhesive clips that is provided unless your hooks are broken or used by another cargo net.
customer_reviews.author: ramon garza

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for the truck bed just behind the cab. I had one like this that lasted for about 5 years being exposed to the elements all that time. It's very well made, stretches to securely contain packages and material and is quite handy to have.
customer_reviews.author: DaveH

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this cargo netting is flat so I can use as cargo netting to hold down gear, when folded, it can be used as a traditional cargo net to hold trunk stuff in place and when stretched across the back of the front seat of my jeep, it comes in handy as a pet divider as well!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Net works but adhesive is weak
customer_reviews.text: This is a great net that I used in my Mazda CX-5. After 1 day of not even using it the adhesive fell of the sides of my trunk. I have strong binding tape so I just reapplied with my own tape and so far it is working. I suggest buying this and either using the screws they provided or buying strong binding tape.
customer_reviews.author: BChicago

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had more bungie to it but works pretty well in hammock mode.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Well built net.
customer_reviews.text: Too big for what I needed, but it was as described.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Combs

customer_reviews.title: Too stretchy
customer_reviews.text: This may work well if you are trying to hold light grocery bags full of tissue. But if any of your cargo is heavy, this net is too "stretchy" and your stuff will slide everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy Installation and will hold a lot of material you don't want sliding in your car.
customer_reviews.author: The_Asian

customer_reviews.title: works great, appears/is the same thing as whats listed as ...
customer_reviews.text: works great, appears/is the same thing as whats listed as "Universal Hammock Style Stretch Cargo Net " I order two different models of nets and received two of the exact same net. This was not a problem but I could have just ordered two instead of two separate items.
customer_reviews.author: st

customer_reviews.title: Popped off
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the net is great, but I followed the directions for attaching it to the vinyl interior of my car in cold weather and it popped right off the next day. Fortunately my car has hooks I could use instead. If it didn't, I'd have had trouble finding another adhesive that would work on the vinyl in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Choosy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leery when I first put it in - I didn't want to use the extra anchors and risk messing up my car so I hung two corners on each side of the trunk. It looked small, didn't touch the floor of the trunk but when filled with grocery bags it stretched nicely and held a lot in place. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Multipurpose
customer_reviews.text: Used this as an inexpensive way to keep the dogs from jumping up to the front seat of the car. Worked quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Solid State Tactical

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Use this for tying down gear on my ATV when I blaze trails on my property. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Schipano

customer_reviews.title: The little sticky pads that it comes with are not ...
customer_reviews.text: The little sticky pads that it comes with are not strong enough for the net, it kept falling off and was unusable after a while, had to buy a different one with hooks
customer_reviews.author: iway

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be made well enough to last. Attaches easily to Jeep cargo knobs at sides. Not perfect, but better than nothing to keep grocery bags from dumping over. I attach mine like a hammock, but can also be used spread out as illustrated.
customer_reviews.author: fjmrozek

customer_reviews.title: Too Big for my 2010 Hyundai Accent.
customer_reviews.text: Too Big for my 2010 Hyundai Accent. Completed an easy return with Amazon as always.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: fits nicely on my cx-5
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy it but I did measure to get an idea if it would fit. The end attachments included is unusable though so I had to buy 4 carabiners in order to hook them nicely. It stretches smoothly and not to tight that even with big loads.
customer_reviews.author: AveMarAriAme

customer_reviews.title: ... the included mounting pieces are inconvenient - not an easy net to use immediately
customer_reviews.text: This cargo net does not come with four hooks at the corners and the included mounting pieces are inconvenient - not an easy net to use immediately. Not the right size for Jeep Wrangler.
customer_reviews.author: Paula M. Hein

customer_reviews.title: I purchased two of these to use as under-shelf storage ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to use as under-shelf storage in a closet. They are very well made and work perfectly. I suspended them using S-hooks in all four corners.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Hines

customer_reviews.title: great net,,,
customer_reviews.text: I order'd mine too big,,,,but it will stretch it out to fit... and for the price,,it is well worth it... elastic at the corners,,fit well over the hubs,for tie down... it comes with the necessary equipment,,if your car is not so equipped...
customer_reviews.author: waltz amazon

customer_reviews.title: This is stretchy - which can be good or bad depending upon your use
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for use in our Toyota Sienna van - which is our camping van. This is stretchy - which can be good or bad depending upon your use. We will keep them in the van for future use.
customer_reviews.author: JR Little

customer_reviews.title: Good Cargo Net
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make a barrier between the front and back seat of my crew cab truck to keep the dogs from jumping into the front. It is not strong or rigid enough to physically hold them back, but just the visual barrier worked for me. Good results.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very useful to keep things from rolling around the car like it.
customer_reviews.author: pauline

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: its ok. seems solid. pretty stretchy. the corners are loops. it works for what i needed it for. not super strong, wouldn’t recommend for holding down a load, but it’ll keep light stuff from blowing out if you can pull it tight over it. hooks on the corners would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: jerrod

customer_reviews.title: but adjusted it a little with zip ties and works great. Doesn't come with S hooks
customer_reviews.text: Was too big for my Jeep Wrangler, but adjusted it a little with zip ties and works great. Doesn't come with S hooks, so I had to buy them myself. But those are cheap. Must have for all wranglers!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be Better!
customer_reviews.text: What a deal this is! So much less expensive than Honda parts and perfect for my CR-V. Use as an envelope style net, folded and stretched crossways, or flat and anchored at for corners to secure big stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Natural Health Doc

customer_reviews.title: itself net is good quality, but thought nobody thinked about mounting
customer_reviews.text: itself net is good quality, but thought nobody thinked about mounting. that fasteners which are in box aren't usefull. two sided tape can't mount enought and screws are slow down soon and damage car plastic too. more functionall could be some plastic hooks
customer_reviews.author: ghiblii

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: It had no hooks and this was not specified in the description. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Errol

customer_reviews.title: Worthless piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Useless. Used it once and the stitching on each side unraveled and the whole thing fell apart. Tried to return it and they wouldn't let me because I bought it 35 days ago. Seriously, it feel apart after I used it one time to secure grocery bags.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C. Sun

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a net like this for the back of my Jeep Wrangler and could not find one till I looked here. This net is a great fit and holds my stuff down when I put the top down om Wrangler and I don't have to worry about stuff blowing out. I really like that you can use this net in so many different ways and it is adjustable too...great item, thanks
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Buy me
customer_reviews.text: Great product that comes with everything you need to install on your minivan. Works great when you need that extra storage space on long trips
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Hooks well to the hooks on my Honda Accord, ...
customer_reviews.text: Hooks well to the hooks on my Honda Accord, without the need for the extra parts that the net comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Bell cargo net needs better adhesive.
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive was not strong enough to stick where the force against it was greatest. I'll have to drill holes.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell and Alice Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Bell 22-1-33653-8 Cargo Net
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good net, numerous ways to attach it and it holds up well. There's "sticky back" mounts also included but those won't hold when the weather turns cold so I just used the screws and bolts mounted in the trunk already. Easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Saurez

customer_reviews.title: Neat!  Great for vertical hanging!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and nice looks, fitted on my Mitsubishi Montero Sport 2006. Will not fit adequately spread on the floor hooks, but will fit perfectly on the sided-higher hooks so you will use this net as a folded vertical stretched hanging-net.
customer_reviews.author: Adrenaline UIO

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat compatible with my vehicle
customer_reviews.text: This cargo net was a lot less expensive than those sold by the car's manufacturer but it is not properly shaped for my vehicle so it will not hold down heavy items like groceries or even sports balls. Guess I need bins.
customer_reviews.author: E.J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, like all Bell products. Arrived quickly. Very handy item, especially for motocyclists.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great tough net
customer_reviews.text: I've stretched this net to its limits for a length of time and it is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: pyrocotton

customer_reviews.title: Earthquake recommended
customer_reviews.text: I use this to secure articles stored above my cars in garage in case of earthquake.
customer_reviews.author: grfx

customer_reviews.title: decent product, but you'll need to do some MacGyver-ing to install
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect the adhesive to hold at all...instead of drilling screw holes in my car's trunk, I secured the corners to random existing holes in the trunk's metal frame with steel ties.
customer_reviews.author: addisraymo

customer_reviews.title: cargo net
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, I like this net. It has 2 attachments at each end, and since I only have 1 hook at each end, I have to double up the attachments. Also, the net isn't as deep as I would like, and the first time I used it, a large melon rolled right out of it! But as long as something has a flat bottom, it's fine. I'm making it work for me.
customer_reviews.author: souptonuts

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This cargo net is wonderful and exactly like the picture and description. It shipped in one day too with regular shipping. I installed it in my Mustang in the front area of the trunk and it holds 10 bags of groceries or just one without anything tipping or moving around. I am so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Works great for 07 Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: I had to cinch up the crd for it to fit but better than it being too small. It works well with my 2007 Honda Odyssey. And a bargain
customer_reviews.author: knockonwood

customer_reviews.title: Works great. We'll see how the durability holds up
customer_reviews.text: Using it to secure the boat seats on the floor of the boat during towing. Works great. We'll see how the durability holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Ochs

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Pads won't stick to plastic surface.. Will de-attach with interior heat! I refuse to use the screws provided so just superglued it .. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Garcisco

customer_reviews.title: Helpful. no more runaway stuff
customer_reviews.text: Good product and great bargain for the price. My groceries are not moving to the front anymore when I step on the brake on my tacoma. I used the cleats to support the net and bungee cords to hold the net on the floor. Others cost 3x more.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the dogs out.
customer_reviews.text: Got it to keep the dogs in the back of my van and it works. Put it behind the front seats.
customer_reviews.author: Merlinskiss

product_meta.title: Bell Automotive 22-1-33653-8 Cargo Net
product_meta.description: Bell Automotive's Cargo Net is ideal for rear cargo storage in cars, vans, trucks, SUVs and more. The 45-inch x 24-inch cargo net stretches to 60 inches for storing groceries, sports equipment and car supplies. Permanently mount with sheet metal screws, or for more temporary applications, mount with the adhesive pads. All mounting hardware included.
feature_bullets: 45 inch x 24 inch cargo net stretches to 60 inches for superb storage
All required mounting hardware included for two installation options
Ideal for rear cargo storage in cars, vans, trucks, and SUVs
Easily store groceries, sports equipment, or other supplies

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars555 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
